rule.name: Bitwise operator in conditional
rule.description: Checks for bitwise operations in conditionals. Although being written on purpose in some rare cases, bitwise operations are considered to be too “smart”. Smart code is not easy to understand.

rule.name: Broken nil check
rule.description: The broken nil check in Objective-C in some cases returns just the opposite result.

rule.name: Broken null check
rule.description: The broken null check itself will crash the program.

rule.name: Broken oddness check
rule.description: Checking oddness by x%2==1 won’t work for negative numbers. Use x&1==1, or x%2!=0 instead.

rule.name: Collapsible if statements
rule.description: This rule detects instances where the conditions of two consecutive if statements can combined into one in order to increase code cleanness and readability.

rule.name: Constant conditional operator
rule.description: conditionaloperator whose conditionals are always true or always false are confusing.

rule.name: Constant if expression
rule.description: if statements whose conditionals are always true or always false are confusing.

rule.name: Dead code
rule.description: Code after return, break, continue, and throw statements are unreachable and will never be executed.

rule.name: Double negative
rule.description: There is no point in using a double negative, it is always positive.

rule.key: for loop should be while loop
rule.name: For loop should be while loop
rule.description: Under certain circumstances, some for loops can be simplified to while loops to make code more concise.

rule.name: Goto statement
rule.description: “Go To Statement Considered Harmful”

rule.name: Misplaced nil check
rule.description: The nil check is misplaced. In Objective-C, sending a message to a nil pointer simply does nothing. But code readers may be confused about the misplaced nil check.

rule.name: Misplaced null check
rule.description: The null check is misplaced. In C and C++, sending a message to a null pointer could crash the app. When null is misplaced, either the check is useless or it’s incorrect.

rule.name: Multiple unary operator
rule.description: Multiple unary operator can always be confusing and should be simplified.

rule.name: Return from finally block
rule.description: Returning from a finally block is not recommended.

rule.name: Throw exception from finally block
rule.description: Throwing exceptions within a finally block may mask other exceptions or code defects.

rule.key: avoid branching statement as last in loop
rule.name: Avoid branching statement as last in loop
rule.description: Having branching statement as the last statement inside a loop is very confusing, and could largely be forgetting of something and turning into a bug.

rule.key: default label not last in switch statement
rule.name: Default label not last in switch statement
rule.description: It is very confusing when default label is not the last label in a switch statement.

rule.name: Inverted logic
rule.description: An inverted logic is hard to understand.

rule.key: non case label in switch statement
rule.name: Non case label in switch statement
rule.description: It is very confusing when default label is not the last label in a switch statement.

rule.name: Parameter reassignment
rule.description: Reassigning values to parameters is very problematic in most cases.

rule.name: Switch statements should have default
rule.description: Switch statements should a default statement.

rule.key: too few branches in switch statement
rule.name: Too few branches in switch statement
rule.description: To increase code readability, when a switch consists of only a few branches, it’s much better to use if statement.

rule.name: Empty catch statement
rule.description: This rule detects instances where an exception is caught, but nothing is done about it.

rule.name: Empty do while statement
rule.description: This rule detects instances where a do-while statement does nothing.

rule.name: Empty else block
rule.description: This rule detects instances where a else statement does nothing.

rule.name: Empty finally statement
rule.description: This rule detects instances where a finally statement does nothing.

rule.name: Empty for statement
rule.description: This rule detects instances where a for statement does nothing.

rule.name: Empty if statement
rule.description: This rule detects instances where a condition is checked, but nothing is done about it.

rule.name: Empty switch statement
rule.description: This rule detects instances where a switch statement does nothing.

rule.name: Empty try statement
rule.description: This rule detects instances where a try statement is empty.

rule.name: Empty while statement
rule.description: This rule detects instances where a while statement does nothing.

rule.name: Obj c boxed expressions
rule.description: This rule locates the places that can be migrated to the new Objective-C literals with boxed expressions.

rule.name: Obj c container literals
rule.description: This rule locates the places that can be migrated to the new Objective-C literals with container literals.

rule.name: Obj cns number literals
rule.description: This rule locates the places that can be migrated to the new Objective-C literals with number literals.

rule.name: Obj c object subscripting
rule.description: This rule locates the places that can be migrated to the new Objective-C literals with object subscripting.

rule.name: Long variable name
rule.description: Variables with long names harm readability.

rule.name: Short variable name
rule.description: Variable with a short name is hard to understand what it stands for. Variable with name, but the name has number of characters less than the threshold will be emitted.

rule.name: Redundant conditional operator
rule.description: This rule detects three types of redundant conditional operators:

rule.name: Redundant if statement
rule.description: This rule detects unnecessary if statements.

rule.name: Redundant local variable
rule.description: This rule detects cases where a variable declaration immediately followed by a return of that variable.

rule.name: Redundant nil check
rule.description: C/C++-style null check in Objective-C like foo!=nil&&[foobar] is redundant, since sending a message to a nil object in this case simply return a false-y value.

rule.name: Unnecessary else statement
rule.description: When an if statement block ends with a return statement, or all branches in the if statement block end with return statements, then the else statement is unnecessary. The code in the else statement can be run without being in the block.

rule.name: Useless parentheses
rule.description: This rule detects useless parentheses.

rule.name: Cyclomatic complexity
rule.description: Cyclomatic complexity is determined by the number of linearly independent paths through a program’s source code. In other words, cyclomatic complexity of a method is measured by the number of decision points, like if, while, and for statements, plus one for the method entry.

rule.name: Long class
rule.description: Long class generally indicates that this class tries to so many things. Each class should do one thing and one thing well.

rule.name: Long line
rule.description: When number of characters for one line of code is very long, it largely harm the readability. Break long line of code into multiple lines.

rule.name: Long method
rule.description: Long method generally indicates that this method tries to so many things. Each method should do one thing and one thing well.

rule.name: Ncss method count
rule.description: This rule counts number of lines for a method by counting Non Commenting Source Statements (NCSS). NCSS only takes actual statements into consideration, in other words, ignores empty statements, empty blocks, closing brackets or semicolons after closing brackets. Meanwhile, statement that is break into multiple lines contribute only one count.

rule.name: Nested block depth
rule.description: This rule indicates blocks nested more deeply than the upper limit.

rule.name: N path complexity
rule.description: NPath complexity is determined by the number of execution paths through that method. Compared to cyclomatic complexity, NPath complexity has two outstanding characteristics: first, it distinguish between different kinds of control flow structures; second, it takes the various type of acyclic paths in a flow graph into consideration.

rule.name: Too many fields
rule.description: A class with too many fields indicates it does too many things and is lack of proper abstraction. It can be resigned to have fewer fields.

rule.name: Too many methods
rule.description: A class with too many methods indicates it does too many things and hard to read and understand. It usually contains complicated code, and should be refactored.

rule.name: Too many parameters
rule.description: Methods with too many parameters are hard to understand and maintain, and are thirsty for refactorings, like Replace Parameter With method, Introduce Parameter Object, or Preserve Whole Object.

rule.name: Unused local variable
rule.description: This rule detects local variables that are declared, but not used.

rule.name: Unused method parameter
rule.description: This rule detects parameters that are not used in the method.

rule.name: Feature envy
rule.description: Feature envy

rule.key: ivar assignment outside accessors or init
rule.name: Ivar assignment outside accessors or init
rule.description: Ivar assignment outside accessors or init

rule.name: Jumbled incrementer
rule.description: Jumbled incrementer

rule.name: Missing break in switch statement
rule.description: Missing break in switch statement

rule.name: Must override hash with isEqual
rule.description: Must override hash with isEqual

rule.key: switch statements don't need default when fully covered
rule.name: Switch statements don't need default when fully covered
rule.description: Switch statements don't need default when fully covered

rule.name: Use early exits and continue
rule.description: Use early exits and continue
